content:
TITLE: Running Keycloak with Docker
DESCRIPTION: This command starts a Keycloak server using Docker, exposing it on port 8080 and setting the admin username and password using environment variables. It requires Docker to be installed and running on the system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/example/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker run -p 8080:8080 -e KEYCLOAK_USER=admin -e KEYCLOAK_PASSWORD=admin jboss/keycloak
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting NodeJS example
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the NodeJS example application, usually using `node server.js` or similar. This assumes that `npm install` has been executed successfully. This command starts the server.js file which runs the application
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/example/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing dependencies for NodeJS example
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary dependencies for the NodeJS example application defined in `package.json`. This assumes that `npm` and NodeJS are installed. Make sure you are in the correct directory (where `package.json` file exists).
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/example/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node.js adapter dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Installs all the necessary dependencies for the Keycloak Node.js adapter using npm. This step is required before building or running the adapter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/docs/building.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linking keycloak-connect for development
DESCRIPTION: This command links the local keycloak-connect package to the current NodeJS project, allowing you to use the HEAD code of keycloak-connect without publishing. This is useful during development. Navigate to the keycloak-connect directory first.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/example/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm link ../
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run All Tests (npm)
DESCRIPTION: This command executes all tests defined in the project. It's used to ensure that all functionalities are working as expected.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/docs/tests-development.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Keycloak Standalone
DESCRIPTION: This command starts Keycloak in standalone mode from a local installation. Replace '<Path-To-Keycloak>' with the actual path to the Keycloak installation directory. Keycloak must be installed on the system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/example/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
/<Path-To-Keycloak>/bin/standalone.sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning Keycloak Node.js Connect Repository
DESCRIPTION: Clones the Keycloak Node.js Connect repository from GitHub and navigates into the project directory. This is the first step in setting up the project for local development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/docs/building.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect.git
cd keycloak-nodejs-connect
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Start Keycloak Server (npm)
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Keycloak server, which is a prerequisite for running integration tests. The server needs to be running to execute the integration tests successfully.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/docs/tests-development.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run server:start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Linting the Node.js code
DESCRIPTION: Runs the linter to ensure the code is properly formatted and follows the project's code style guidelines. This should be executed before submitting any pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/docs/building.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run lint
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Node.js and Git versions
DESCRIPTION: Checks the installed versions of Node.js and Git to ensure they meet the minimum requirements for building the Keycloak Node.js adapter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/docs/building.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
node --version
git --version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Specific Test (tape)
DESCRIPTION: This command runs a specific test file using the `tape` testing framework. It's helpful for focusing on particular features or components during development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak-nodejs-connect/blob/main/docs/tests-development.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
tape test/grant-manager-spec.js
```
